articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: James Redmayne, Catarina Demony
articles.description: The leaders of the Commonwealth grouping of nations met on Thursday ahead of a summit in the South Pacific nation of Samoa that will feature talks on climate change and the question of reparations for Britain's role in transatlantic slavery.
articles.title: Commonwealth nations to discuss slavery reparations, climate change

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Polish President Andrzej Duda on Thursday condemned North Korea's dispatch of troops to Russia for its war against Ukraine as a global security threat, Yoon's office said.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon, Poland's Duda condemn N.Korea troop dispatch to Russia

articles.author: Cheney Orr
articles.description: The journey of Rossanna and Widman began in the Guatemalan village of San Juan La Laguna, on the turquoise Lake Atitlan, where they met when he bought the tortillas she was selling for lunch.
articles.title: In Guatemala, families mourn the migrants who never reached the USA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former British nurse and convicted child serial killer Lucy Letby on Thursday asked a London court to let her appeal against her conviction for trying to murder a newborn baby, amid questions over the fairness of her trials.
articles.title: British nurse Lucy Letby appeals single attempted murder conviction

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Uruguayan Alvaro Delgado, a 55-year-old former senator and the conservative ruling coalition's continuity candidate for president, is trailing his center-left rival in the polls, but has a wild card up his sleeve. A dark horse ally in third place.
articles.title: In Uruguay election, conservatives hopes pinned to a dark horse kingmaker

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Parliament on Thursday handed its annual Sakharov Prize for Freedom of Thought to Venezuelan opposition leaders Maria Corina Machado and Edmundo Gonzalez for "representing the people of Venezuela fighting to restore freedom and democracy."
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition leaders Machado, Gonzalez awarded Sakharov Prize

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: Since a new cafe called Missini Sweets opened this month in North Mitrovica, Kosovo, a smattering of guests have enjoyed its drinks and sweets. But the business has faced headwinds: it is run by ethnic Albanians and local ethnic Serbs refuse to enter.
articles.title: Ethnic tensions dominate life in divided Kosovan city, decades after war

articles.author: Abdi Sheikh
articles.description: Thousands of security cameras have been installed across Somalia's capital to monitor the movement of al Shabaab militants and reassure residents, but they have also made business owners fearful of reprisal attacks.
articles.title: Somalia security cameras aim to cut al Shabaab attacks but militants fight back

articles.author: Lefteris Papadimas, Alexandros Avramidis
articles.description: In Greece, one of the world's largest chestnut producers, farmer Anestis Altinis searches for nuts suitable for harvest. But after months of searing heat and drought, most have not ripened, a familiar problem in his village where output is expected to drop 90%.
articles.title: Greece's chestnut harvest set to shrink, hit by drought and heat
